intro: Prangos lophoptera, commonly known as the Kashmir snow lotus, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold climates. Its leaves are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps protect it from harsh weather conditions. Prangos lophoptera is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
